message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper deals with probabilistic approaches to classification and information extraction, which are core topics in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on modeling scope-limited features, which are relevant to NLP tasks such as information extraction from web pages. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a hierarchical probabilistic model, which involves estimating unobserved random parameters, and uses both local and global features for classification. This makes the paper relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
